description:
Location: Irvine, United States of America

Thales people architect solutions that enable two-thirds of planes to take off and land safely. We create in-flight entertainment systems that engross 50 million fliers every year and we develop the avionics that control the world’s largest commercial aircrafts. Our simulators train the next generation of pilots for fighter jets, transporters and search and rescue helicopters. And, together, each and every member of our aerospace team makes a difference.

Materials Coordinator

Irvine, CA (Onsite)

Position Summary

Thales is looking for a Materials Coordinator to perform physical and administrative tasks involved in Centralized Discrepant Material Area (CDMA); examine material to ensure the physical count matches the Quality Notification (QN) quantity; distribute materials to inventory, production work orders, material reservation, or conducts scrapping process; prepare and maintains records of items processed internally and externally.

In this position you will also conduct cycle counts in CDMA area to ensure inventory is accurate; create and process Quality Notifications. Individual will need to create CDMA report and distribute to all parties that are associated with department and action QN’s to proper buyer, quality or engineer personnel.

Tier 1 - Referral Bonus Payout - $2,500

Key Areas of Responsibility

  • Analyze SAP data in support of Distribution Operations Process shipments, validate inventory movements, and make recommendations to management on optimal processing methods; Maintain relationships with internal customers, ensuring inventory accuracy and integrity are upheld.
  • Develop continuous process improvement plans and initiatives; maintain operational plans to support customer shipments and production needs (will involve working Saturdays and some Sundays).
  • Maintain and promote a safe work environment for all employees; create and sustain a culture to support lean initiatives and promote lean values.
  • Interfaces with other functional areas such as receiving inspection, production control and shipping department in order to complete QN task.
  • Create Quality Notification Reports using Excel.


Minimum Qualifications

  • HS Diploma with a minimum of 2 years of related experience and training.
  • Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business workflows related to a warehouse distribution center; ability to write reports, business correspondence, and other communications related to the warehouse distribution center.
  • Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.
  • Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.
  • SAP or other ERP system experience; proficiency with MS Excel (V-lookup, pivot tables, etc.).
  • Utilize project management experience to communicate and coordinate teams to complete identified projects (scrapping project.)


If you’re excited about working with Thales, but not meeting the requirements for this position, we encourage you to join our Talent Community!

Special Position Requirements

  • Schedule: Core Business Hours Monday-Friday and will occasionally involve working some Saturdays and Sundays.
  • Physical Environment: Warehouse Environment.
  • Physical Demands: Must be able to lift a minimum of 50 pounds.
  • Regulatory Compliance Requirements: None.
